duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist the Account Manager in coordinating all aspects of executing the security contract at the assigned location, including technical and managerial tasks.

Assign work tasks to Security Professionals, direct their work, and serve as the first direct supervisory contact for shift supervisors or Security Professionals regarding performance, operations, and department needs.

Supervise, motivate, coach, and evaluate the work performance of Security Professionals, conducting on-the-job training for new employees, and overseeing all reports and pass downs generated by and for the Security Department.

Manage and supervise all sub-units within the Security Department, respond to minor incidents, and identify personnel problems occurring at posts, forwarding any such issues to Account Manager or Field Supervisor as appropriate.

Recommend counseling and/or disciplinary action as well as respond to client or site emergencies, maintaining positive client/security relationships through frequent tenant/client contact and support.
Occasionally perform Security Professional type job duties on an as-needed basis, but under no circumstances to exceed more than 50% of time in any given workweek.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalent required; Some college education or business classes desirable.
